attributes.action: End the weighing of children in Primary and Secondary schools after Lockdown
attributes.background: We want the Government and Parliament to no longer endorse the idea of weighing primary and secondary school students after the end of the Corona Virus Lockdown, which has recently been brought to the attention of the media and has rightfully received backlash.
attributes.additional_details: We want this occurrence to be prevented as it can be extremely detrimental to a student’s mental health, which should be the most important factor when bringing in new rules to a school’s environment. Another issue which may be caused is a relapse or increase in eating disorders, as students may grow to become self conscious about their weight and may compare themselves to other pupils, which will create an unhealthy learning environment.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/548219

attributes.action: Give us scientific data to prove schools are safe to open
attributes.background: Explain why you have to close pubs and restaurants if our kids are apparently safe and won't spread disease. Also explain why you yourself are still not sitting in Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: So us as parents can see if it is safe to put our children in a school environment.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. You might like to know that the House of Commons is currently sitting in Westminster. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Make working from home attractive proposition for all.
attributes.background: Make working from home the new norm. Provide tax breaks for companies and employees, to do this, tax incentives for home office, equipment, internet access, computer equipment, computer security. Tax breaks to convert existing office blocks to homes.
attributes.additional_details: Britain can be a leader in the home office environment..We have proved it can work make it happen.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318057

attributes.action: Allow us to sing and worship God at liberty.
attributes.background:
On behalf of Christians who share this same view, I would like the government to kindly remove the restriction on our places of worship.
Under the Human Rights Act 1998, Article 9:Freedom of thought, belief and religion, we are given the right to put our thoughts and beliefs into action.
attributes.additional_details:
I want the government to do this because singing and praising God  is a crucial part of our worship. 
Based on advise from relevant professionals, Church leaders have taken the necessary measures, e.g. distancing, sanitising the environment etc., and acting appropriately. 
Church leaders have acted in view of public safety, public order and health of others to minimise risks.
With all that has been put in place, singing should be seen as a least way of spreading the virus.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328566

attributes.action: Defund the UK police and invest the funds into communities
attributes.background: For many, 'Defund the Police' can come across as radical. However, taking a look beyond the surface shows a promising initiative that could transform the UK for the better. The police are used for all manner of problems, even ones that would benefit from more specialised assistance.
attributes.additional_details: In 2018-19 the Government spent £28.8bn on the criminal justice system. This is more than we spend on primary education, the environment or social care. 750 youth centres have closed since 2012 according to Unite, leading to a loss of 4,500 workers. Black people are 9.7 times more likely to be stopped and searched according to official figures. In 2017-18 the police used force 62,000 times, more than a third of those incidents involved Black people, according to the London Datastore.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to make a clear ask of the UK Government or Parliament. You want the Government to provide funding for local communities to tackle problems that would "benefit from specialised assistance" however you don't specify which problems these are or what initiatives you would want this funding to be spent on.

You could start a petition which called for the Government to increase funding to tackle specified community issues, for example youth services or public housing, if that is something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Crack down on the meat and dairy industry and eventually ban their production
attributes.background: Laws and regulations need to be immediately introduced to crack down on the meat and dairy industry. A safety net and re-hiring scheme also needs to be set up for farmers who will be out of work. Education on the effects of a meat and dairy diet must also become compulsory for pupils at school.
attributes.additional_details: The meat and dairy industry is one of the driving forces of global warming and the increase in greenhouse gases. It is also the main cause of the UK’s number 1 killer; heart disease. Heart attacks are most often caused by cholesterol that is only found in animal products. By eventually banning meat and dairy, it will save our struggling NHS millions of pounds annually. Our Government is claiming to care for the environment, animals and our health, then why not tackle the worst thing for these?

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330298

attributes.action: Increase Environmental Protection and Green Focus in Covid-19 Recovery Plan
attributes.background: The government must enforce stronger environmental protection within plans for Covid-19 recovery. It must implement a green focus and invest in active travel, energy efficiency, renewable energy, nature tourism, wildlife and environmental conservation, and other green projects.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite declaring a climate emergency in 2019 the UK Covid-19 recovery plan has an overly strong focus on construction and development at the expense of protecting the natural environment.
Polls show a public preference for a change to the economy and a greener focus, which was promised but quickly forgotten. 
The UK has failed to meet the majority of climate action targets. 
It is our responsibility to protect the natural environment, especially after it has provided us with so many benefits.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

attributes.action: Protect UK Food Standards
attributes.background: For the health of all UK citizens the Government should ensure that all food eaten in the UK -either imported or produced locally- complies with strict standards of food and hygiene, animal welfare and environmental standards.COVID-19 has highlighted the importance of food security and traceability.
attributes.additional_details:
We call upon 
1. The Government and all parliamentary 
parties to re-affirm their commitments 
to ensuring that UK food standards on 
safety and welfare will not be weakened or 
undermined by post-Brexit trade deals.

2. Public health, consumer and environment 
organisations to combine efforts to prevent 
the undermining of high food standards in 
the UK.

3. All UK food industries to prevent the 
creation of a two-tier food market of high 
standards for UK production alongside 
weaker international standards allowed for 
imports, with these likely to be marketed to 
people on low incomes.

rejection.details:
We have opened the following petitions on this issue which you may wish to sign:

Disallow Food that is Lower than the Minimum UK Production & Welfare Standards: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326837

Legislate in the Agriculture Bill to protect the UK’s Food & Farming Sector: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321419

attributes.action: Reconsider the enforced and indefinite closure of zoos deemed 'Covid secure'
attributes.background:
Many zoos are now deemed a 'Covid secure' environment for the general public and the government insists these remain closed.

This petition asks for a reconsideration in light of the fact that many public UK beaches, parks and other beauty spots are not 'Covid secure' but yet remain open.
attributes.additional_details:
Zoos are to remain closed for an indefinite period, despite being ‘Covid secure’, able to safely limit numbers and enforce social distancing rules.

Zoos are almost entirely dependent on income generated from visitors. Prolonged closure risks losing these zoos, and their vital conservation work, forever.

There are also double standards. The government has determined that many public UK beaches, parks and other beauty spots not deemed 'Covid secure' can open, as can non-essential shops.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Allow Zoos and Wildlife attractions to reopen with social distancing in place: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323881

Provide financial help to zoos, aquariums, & rescue centres during the pandemic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308733

www.gov.uk/coronavirus

attributes.action: Ban the sale of disposable BBQs
attributes.background: Ban the sale and use of disposable BBQ’s
attributes.additional_details: In recent weeks, hot weather has led to a surge in the public buying and using disposable BBQs yet, the damage and destruction it causes the environment, alongside the intense pressure it puts on our emergency services is unfathomable. The news is constantly showing the death of wildlife, ruined countryside and precious resources being used to put out the out of control fires these BBQs can cause. They are single use, unsustainable and cause more trouble than they are worth in the modern age.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Ban disposable barbecues.
attributes.background: Ban disposable barbecues, these are a huge cause of forest fires and they are creating a litter problem. This is having an effect on our environment and is damaging our ever so important eco system.
attributes.additional_details: Our woodlands and forests are important and need to be protected. Trees provide so much for nature, they help to protect our environment and are important towards sustaining life on this planet.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Make history a mandatory GCSE subject and include racism in the curriculum
attributes.background: Parliament must make history a mandatory subject for all students including in GCSE. They must also ensure the curriculum involves teaching British involvement in slavery, colonialism and its history of racism.
attributes.additional_details: History is essential to tackling racism in the UK. Too many BAME individuals are suffering at the hands of unchecked underlying racism due to the poor educational attitudes towards race relations. History becoming a mandatory subject overcomes this barrier. It ensures that students understand the current socioeconomic environment through a comprehensive learning of the past treatment of BAME individuals as a result of British history of racism, involvement in slavery and colonialism.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to change how schools teach history, but it's not clear exactly what changes you want the Government to make.

HIstory is already a compulsory subject for Key Stage 3. For Key Stage 4, the Government sets the national curriculum, including "core" and "foundation" subjects, but does not specify that particular GCSEs are mandatory. This is a decision for individual schools to make based on the qualifications they offer.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality

You could start a petition calling on the Government to make history a core subject for Key Stage 4 students, if you want to petition on this change, as distinguished from the petitions that are already open, listed above.

attributes.action: Open our Churches and other places of worship for private prayer.
attributes.background: Now that non-essential shops and services are allowed to open, it is time that churches should be allowed to open also. Religious buildings which are large enough to maintain the necessary distancing and hygiene regulations should be available again as places of prayer, quiet and reflection.
attributes.additional_details: At a time when such services as estate agents have the freedom to open their premises, it is contrary to justice to continue to deny to churchgoers access to an environment which by very many people is regarded as essential for their mental and spiritual welfare. A church, synagogue or mosque is a visible sign of local community, and freedom to use a place of worship is a basic human right, the denial of which we have hitherto tolerated patiently. It is time to put an end to this privation.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317856

attributes.action: Change the start of the school year to January
attributes.background: We would like the government to consider changing the start of the school year to January.
attributes.additional_details: The coronavirus has had such a disruption on schools. This change would allow children to catch up with work they they have missed and get used to a new school environment due to social distancing. The teachers could ease them back to classes they are used from Sept to Dec. This would take the pressure of parents, children and teachers. It would allow children to prepare for exams and not miss out on transition to different years and new schools

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306954

attributes.action: Ban the sale of sky lanterns
attributes.background:
Sky lanterns are a fire hazard and cause much damage to the environment, including killing owls and other animals. They are simply litter and the remains are left for others to clean up.

We ask that Sky lanterns be banned for sale to remove this menace from our skies.
attributes.additional_details:
A number of councils have already banned sky lanterns being released on council land but we would ask that this ban be more wide spread and made law.

https://www.countrysideonline.co.uk/care-for-the-countryside/sky-lanterns/

https://www.keepwalestidy.cymru/news/sky-lantern-bans-now-in-place-across-wales

https://metro.co.uk/2020/04/15/fire-chiefs-warn-campaign-light-sky-lanterns-nhs-workers-12557429/

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310556

attributes.action: Remove NI and Tax deductions from NHS frontline staff during COVID-19
attributes.background: Enact a temporary change to the taxation system to allow all NHS frontline staff to benefit from 0% tax and NI contributions during the COVID-19 pandemnic.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst many have now benefited from furlough and had much of their income saved by the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme, these workers are putting themselves more at risk than anyone else, often working in less safe environments and longer hours, whilst primarily there to save the lives of 10,000s throughout the country.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Reduce working time and travelling after lockdown
attributes.background: Our environment has benefited already from lockdown.  People are finding out what is essential. In 1973 (during the miners’ strike) productivity went UP during the three day week. We can make things work with lessened work-time and reduced travelling. Let’s NOT ‘go back to normal’ but find a new way
attributes.additional_details: It has been seen, in a very short while, that the environmental impact of humanity on the earth has lessened with the cutbacks involved in lockdown. People are discovering more supportive and compassionate ways of interacting. We have an opportunity here to change the way we live, and lessen our impact. Now is an ideal opportunity to find different ways of living.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.
	
We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could start a new petition asking the UK Government and Parliament to provide incentives for working from home or to reduce the maximum number of working hours, if that's what you'd like to happen.

We've published these petitions about changes to how people work which you may wish to sign: 
Require suitable businesses offer remote & flexible working to employees
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318057

Study impact of home working on health & the environment and act on the results
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317466

attributes.action: Forbid trading to non essential business & services on Sundays.
attributes.background:
Our main concern is the effects on the environment but also we want society to restore their spiritual values and to have peace of mind. 

We should take the lesson of the coronavirus epidemic as an example of the benefits of having less people on the streets as this reduces pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important to reduce pollution and there's no question about it. These days people can buy online so why do we need more people on the streets on Sundays.

Less shops means: less cars, trains, energy consumption, rubbish, noise, etc. This will allow the air to clean and nature to flourish better. 

This would also reduce accidents and the need for more police on the and emergency services on the streets. 

This would help to reduce stress on society.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310336

attributes.action: Early release of Prisoners to avoid a surge of Corona Virus Cases
attributes.background: Release some offenders in UK Prisons in order to ease pressures due to the coronavirus pandemic. As many of the prisons are overcrowded, it is an extremely unsafe environment. An emergency virus plan should be enforced immediately, for the safety of prisoners and staff.
attributes.additional_details: Prisoners are particularly vulnerable to the effects of the coronavirus, where it is inevitable that such a virus will spread rapidly and eventually spiral out of control. After a risk assessment for prisoners who are on remand, aswell as other prisoners who do not pose a threat to themselves or society, an early release will slow down the spread of this deadly disease. Action must be taken to prevent death in prisons all over the country.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/305604

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

attributes.action: Close JD Sports Plc Warehouse during COVID-19
attributes.background: We would like the Government to consider closing JD Sports Plc warehouse, and other retail warehouses, during the COVID-19 outbreak to prevent the spread of the virus.
attributes.additional_details: JD Sports Plc in particular have no safety provisions in place to support workers through this time and are effectively creating a hostile environment for this virus to spread.

rejection.details:
The Government has imposed a number of restrictions on individuals and businesses as a result of the coronavirus outbreak. You can find out what you can and can't do here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/coronavirus-outbreak-faqs-what-you-can-and-cant-do/coronavirus-outbreak-faqs-what-you-can-and-cant-do

If you want the Government to consider closing down offices and businesses and ordering home working, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301439

If you want the Government to close all businesses that are not vital, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308122

If you want the Government to implement a complete lockdown, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310805

If you want the Government to close all shops including supermarkets, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310341

If you want the Government to close all unnecessary businesses including takeaways, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307294

If you would like the Government to close all non-essential online stores and warehouses, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/311765

Read correspondence with Government Ministers asking further questions: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/

attributes.action: Request universities to allow refunds of accommodation during COVID-19
attributes.background: Due to coronavirus affecting universities, they have  gone digital, therefore many students have returned home for safety, and primarily left due to lectures & seminars being cancelled, which is the prime purpose of university halls. Instead, accommodation is not essential as previously listed.
attributes.additional_details: The government would have the power to tell universities to give the opportunity to cancel/refund students accommodation due to the promise of in person lectures/seminars being impossible in the current environment. This would be Helping with families financially during the COVID-19 epidemic, and allow for a fair outcome that the last weeks from a certain date do not need to be paid my students who have left.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304855

attributes.action: Allow Parents To Choose When To Remove Their Children From School Amid Pandemic
attributes.background:
Given the current situation in the UK with growing concerns for the Coronavirus Pandemic, many parents feel that the decision as to when to remove their child from the school environment should be theirs. 

Parents should be allowed to remove their children from school, when they feel it is right.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents are concerned that removing their child, prior to a Government instruction to close schools, could lead to penalties imposed on Parents for unauthorised absence.

Giving the parent the option to remove there child, if this is a viable option, will allow for smaller class sizes and less chance of community transmission. 

Although children appear to not be affected as badly as the older generations, they can still carry this virus, and spread it through their families, and community.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300399

attributes.action: Reintroduce wolves into the UK
attributes.background: We want the government to discuss reintroducing wolves into rural areas of the UK. Wolves should be integrated into our ecosystem.
attributes.additional_details: The establishment of wolves has a beneficial impact on our environment. Wolves are a keystone species scientifically proven to boost biodiversity diversity and carbon sequestration. They help to regulate deer populations naturally. Wild ungulates tend to be the preferred prey of wolves over livestock.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about releasing wolves in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland are a matter for the Scottish, Welsh and Northern Ireland governments, not the UK Government or Parliament. We could accept a petition calling on the Government to reintroduce wolves to England.

attributes.action: We demand that Rishi Sunak goes to COP 27. The UK has to lead climate action.
attributes.background:
COP26 focused on the ‘what’ and COP27 focuses on the ‘how’. The UK needs to be part of COP to shape the vision into concrete commitments, policies and actions.
UK is off track to ensure a stable future for people, our environment and economies. Not attending shows a lack of leadership and priority.
attributes.additional_details:
During COP26 the UK demonstrated strong climate leadership by negotiating to increase country climate commitments, supporting a shift from 30% to 90% of the global economy being covered by net-zero targets. 
The UK is not quite on track to meet its 2030 climate targets. A report from the UN warns global average temperature rises may be on course for above 2°C even if climate targets are reached, so all governments, including the UK, will need to do much more by 2030 to catalyse action.

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions which call for actions with regard to named individuals, including the Prime Minister, but since you started your petition it has been confirmed that Rishi Sunak will attend COP27.

attributes.action: Protection of Ambulance Crews & NHS Staff
attributes.background: Bring in legislation that enables severe fixed penalties to apply & or imprisonment or an ability to perpetually refuse treatment to anyone maliciously harming our NHS staff including (Ambulance Crews).
attributes.additional_details: It is immoral & unethical these people should endure such treatment when trying to offer help! These people deserve our protection. They deserve as safe as an environment as we can create. This will help reduce the offences & save the public money if staff do not need time off to recover from such unacceptable violent conduct. All should all be given technology support to record offensive behaviours to enable successful prosecutions. Fair treatment should be given to our modern day "angels"

rejection.details:
It is already the case that emergency workers, such as people working with ambulances for the NHS, are protected by law if they face assault or harm at work. They're protected by "The Assaults on Emergency Workers (Offences) Act 2018", among other laws.

Part of the Act provides that anyone found guilty of common assault or battery against an emergency worker could be imprisoned for up to twelve months or fined, or both. 

You can read more about the Government's position on this here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/police-crime-sentencing-and-courts-bill-2021-equality-statements/assault-on-emergency-workers-in-the-police-crime-sentencing-courts-bill-equalities-impact-assessment

You could start a petition asking the Government to increase the penalty for assaulting an emergency worker.

attributes.action: Halt or delay the 2023 ULEZ expansion
attributes.background: Half the expansion of the ULEZ zone to rural areas that do not suffer air pollution. A good portion of the impacted population live in rural areas and drive efficient (60+mpg) cars short distance (under 10k miles per year). This is a big financial blow with minimal improvements for the environment.
attributes.additional_details: With the pandemic having an impact on all of us financially and on our health, supply chain issues with car prices up, the rising living costs, the war, this is needlessly punitive and poorly timed measure.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Revoke local government powers to charge CAZ, LEZ, ZEZ and ULEZ: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618266

attributes.action: UK petrol stations to provide free tyre inflation facilities for motorists.
attributes.background: Create legislation that ensures all motorists have access to free tyre inflation facilities at every UK petrol station at all times.
attributes.additional_details:
Correctly inflated tyres last longer and are better for the environment.
Correctly inflated tyres reduce braking distance and improve stability and safety.
Under-inflated tyres are dangerous.
Under-inflated tyres use more fuel.
Under-inflated tyres create more particulates in the atmosphere.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about what to charge for services provided by service stations are a matter for individual service stations, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

attributes.action: Make deliberately misgendering someone a hate crime.
attributes.background: Deliberately misgendering someone undermines their gender identity, therefore it can be considered transphobic in malicious contexts. This is therefore discrimination and harmful to trans-peoples' mental health and well-being. It should therefore be made a hate crime and banned.
attributes.additional_details: Misgendering, is when a name or pronoun is used about a person (often a transgender person) which does not correctly reflect their gender identity. This undermines the person's identity and can be considered transphobic in malicious contexts. This is therefore discrimination and harmful to trans-peoples' well-being as it creates a hostile environment for them. This can affect their mental health and it therefore should be made a hate crime. Whenever this is done it should be prosecuted.

rejection.details:
The act of deliberating mis-gendering someone is already a hate crime, if a court determines that this act demonstrated hostility based on that person's transgender identity, or that it was motivated by hostility based on their transgender identity.

You can find out more about which acts constitute a hate crime here: https://www.cps.gov.uk/crime-info/hate-crime. 

You might like to sign this petition which calls for a related action:

Create a specific offence of stirring up hatred on grounds of Gender Identity: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617842

attributes.action: Make rail travel cheaper than flying for domestic journeys to lower emissions.
attributes.background:
The difference of impact between travelling by rail and flying should be acknowledged by the government and reflected in the cost of both methods of transport. 

It’s cheaper to fly from one city in the U.K. to another via another county than it is to travel between the same two cities by train.
attributes.additional_details:
A lot of blame is placed on individuals when it comes to making decisions but it is the government’s responsibility to make the choices with less impact accessible to the environment accessible to everyone, not just those with money. 

I believe that public transport should be free and accessible to all, the least the government should be doing is making it more affordable for citizens to choose public transport over driving or flying. 

It’s even cheaper to drive than get the bus in most areas.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 
	
We understand that you are concerned about the cost of public transport compared to the cost of flying, however we're not exactly sure what action you'd like the Government or Parliament to take. In particular, we're not sure whether you'd like the Government to increase taxes on internal flights and subsidise train travel, or if you'd like the government to fund free public transport including trains and buses, or if you'd like something different. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis through Renewables
attributes.background:
It's a no-brainer. This is the cheapest, quickest, most environmentally friendly, safest, most job-creative way.
- Underwater turbines to harness tidal flows and estuary currents
- Wind farms
- Solar panels farms.
- Battery technology to store energy.
- Insulation of buildings.
attributes.additional_details:
Overseas energy supplies are reducing and costing more. Yet we are not taking this God-given opportunity.  The above approach offers HOPE instead of threatening the environment by investment in more fossil fuel and unsafe nuclear power, as currently planned.
We petition the Government and Parliament to think of the good of our country, our global environment and its people, especially the many poor already affected.  Action, not words, are now urgently needed.  Let the UK lead the way for the world by example.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 
	
We're not exactly sure what specific action you'd like the Government or Parliament to take. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You may wish to sign some of these petitions instead: 

Set a target for 70% of UK energy to be renewable by 2030:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612739

Introduce grants for home battery storage systems:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610997

Reintroduce Feed-in Tariffs for domestic solar panels:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609063

Create new publicly owned solar energy company to address fuel & climate crisis:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611416

attributes.action: Commission independent studies on the safety and need for Eco Engineering.
attributes.background: The chemicals used during Eco Engineering operations enter our air, food and water and are suspected to be causing melting of the ice caps. We require independent studies to undertake risk assessments to verify that these chemicals are safe to all living things and will not  damage the environment.
attributes.additional_details: There has been massive controversy regarding the use of Eco Engineering operations and major concerns regarding safety remain. Studies to verify safe use must be commissioned as soon as possible to enable independent bodies with no conflicts of interest to allay public fears once and for all.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the potential impact of certain activities, but we're note sure exactly what you mean by "Eco Engineering operations".

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what activities you would like the Government to commission research into.

attributes.action: Make all H M Government buildings including Downing Street alcohol free
attributes.background: Statutory requirement that alcohol is not present in the work place of  H M Government, in the same way alcohol is not permitted in the work place for NHS staff, airline pilots and Network Rail staff.
attributes.additional_details:
All decisions made by H M Government and in particular in Downing Street should be free of any influence from alcohol. 
It is medically accepted that alcohol impairs judgement and increases risk taking behaviour and it is not accepted in a multitude of workplaces.
As Parliament and H M Government makes decisions that effect the country and its citizens it is clear that alcohol has no place in this work environment.

rejection.details:
We currently have the following petition open which you might like to sign:

Ban alcohol in the Houses of Parliament and all government buildings.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/604101

attributes.action: Parliament to discuss a 'Zero Farage' Referendum
attributes.background: To stop the abuse of our democracy by over-opinionated elderly men forging campaigns funded by wealthy individuals with too many connections to Russian businesses and financial assistance.
attributes.additional_details: There are legitimate concerns that individuals with close connections to Russian Oligarchs or other Russian interests are funding campaigns which seek to bypass and destabilise our Parliamentary democracy.  This concern, especially in the current environment, need to be properly addressed.  It is not enough to sanction the Russian Federation, and arm Ukraine -- we need to ensure such malevolence towards liberal democracies cannot shape/influence what decisions are made and how in this country.

rejection.details:
We understand you are concerned about the way political parties are started and who funds them and why, but it's unclear what specific action you would like the Government to take.

You could start a petition asking for changes to the way political parties and campaigns are funded if that is something you would like to see happen.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for schools to educate over disabilities/conditions/illness.
attributes.background: Make it mandatory for schools to educate children over disabilities / conditions that children have or are diagnosed with in their class to prevent bullying and to help other children understand the disability/condition.
attributes.additional_details: Many children with a disability are bullied or made to feel different. The more we educate, the more children will understand and this will create a better environment and life to the children with disabilities. Let all children thrive. Normalise insulin pumps / colostomy bags / catheters. Let them grow and understand together.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Disability is already part of the statutory curriculum. You can find out more here

https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/1019542/Relationships_Education__Relationships_and_Sex_Education__RSE__and_Health_Education.pdf

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Create protected status for the Teviothead Volcanic Complex and its Environment
attributes.background:
Survey and record the compounded archaeology, history and environment of the Teviothead Volcanic Complex

Create a heritage geopark to protect a unique cultural identity, and geological landscape under immediate on ongoing destruction from commercial blanket forestry and vast wind farm development
attributes.additional_details:
With 40 years in cultural heritage we have continually raised the plight of this regions historic environment to successive local and national Governments and their agencies, MP's and MSP's, to no avail

This neglected region straddles national and county boundaries, and has had no significant updates in its designations in over 50 years

A Scottish petition application to gain protected status has just been rejected on the grounds that this is not within the powers of the Scottish Parliament

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the protection of Teviothead Volcanic Complex, but we're not sure how you want this area to be protected.

In any case, establishing a geopark would be a matter for the landowner or relevant authority, not the Government or Parliament.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Support A417 Option 12, the landscape led solution & preserve our environment
attributes.background: A417 Missing Link is a road upgrade project in Gloucestershire to solve a safety and traffic issue. Option 12 is a landscape led solution that has the least environmental impact with minimised destruction to local ecology, communities, farmland and the AONB. Get behind Option 12, the climate choice
attributes.additional_details: Never has the fragility of our environment and the effects of climate change been more of a concern to the population of our nation, it's the #1 issue. We need to preserve & restore ecology & build resilient agriculture as agreed at COP26. We need to protect the AONB as set out in the NPPF. We need to put the environment at the forefront of every debate and to always find a landscape led solution. A417 Option 12 is the solution. We want Govt to deliver on it's promises to make the climate choice

attributes.action: Ban use of all non biodegradable virgin plastics for packaging by 2023
attributes.background:
In a bid to reduce plastic waste, France is banning plastic packaging for nearly all fruit and vegetables from January 2022, the environment ministry has announced.

The UK should be doing the same.
attributes.additional_details:
Biologists, scientists and doctors have made us all aware of the vast damage virgin plastic non-biodegradable packaging is causing. 

We believe that it is vital the government bans production of the petrochemical based virgin plastics to prevent furthering the  catastrophic effects they are causing.

 Our natural marine life and land biodiversity is at huge risk.

Micro plastics are causing serious health risks to our lives.

There are many alternatives for packaging.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586539

attributes.action: Implement better safety measures within  a school environment
attributes.background: Update the National Curriculum educate students about the impacts of sexaul assault and harrasment on people's lives and wellbeing
attributes.additional_details:
To ensure that all students feel safe at school.
To ensure  students have respect towards each other.
To make sure students don't feel embarrassed to speak up about incidents of harassment.
To ensure that students know about their rights in relation to harassment.
 To educate all young people on sexual and physical assault.

rejection.details:
We currently have two open petition that cover your request which you may like to sign:

Include sexual assault mitigation in the curriculum, save women from violence
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579496

Make the education of sexual consent, assault & rape compulsory in junior school
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579211

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for Food Manufacturers to use recyclable packaging
attributes.background: The packaging used by food companies for everyday household items such as biscuits and crisps are not recyclable, nor is made from recycled material. There needs to be a law to force food manufacturers to use recyclable packaging to package their foods to massively reduce waste to landfill.
attributes.additional_details: In order to massively reduce carbon footprint and take a huge step towards helping our environment manufacturers need to use recyclable packaging. Every packet of biscuits and crisps found on supermarket shelves are not recyclable. Over 6 billion packets of biscuits are consumed in the UK alone every year. All of which end up in landfill. This is unacceptable and it must change ASAP

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the similar action: 

Ban the use of virgin plastics in all packaging sold in the UK before 2023:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586539

Require plastic food containers to contain a minimum percentage recycled plastic:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/596546

attributes.action: criminalize catcalling and street harrassment.
attributes.background: Criminalize catcalling as sexual harassment as it is mostly targeted towards children aged11-17. 6 countries have made it illegal so, join the movement make catcalling illegal. I was 11 when I first experienced catcalling and can't believe we are still accepting sexual harassment.
attributes.additional_details: Sexual harassment is a form of unlawful discrimination under the Equality Act 2010. The law says it's sexual harassment if the behavior is either meant to, or has the effect of violating your dignity, or. creating an intimidating, hostile, degrading, humiliating, or offensive environment. Catcalling should be contained within the definition of sexual harassment and raised to the same level as other forms of harassment within the law.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578940

attributes.action: BBC should create a seperate section for climate emergency on their webpage
attributes.background: Our generation is the last generation which can do something about the environmental threat to our planet. Unless each and everyone of us goes over and beyond in a collective effort to help reverse the damage caused to the planet by human activity climate change will make life impossible on earth.
attributes.additional_details: Media outlets have the ability to influence and shape public opinion. The general public needs more high quality information and qualified guidance on what they can do to help save the planet. BBC should create a dedicated section for climate emergency and environment  to help raise awareness and generate debate. Being a non commercial media organisation the credibility of the BBC brand combined with their well funded science based reporting resources can become a force for change.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a decision for the BBC.

attributes.action: Educate that personality disorders should not be stigmatised as bad
attributes.background: Often in media and horror movies alike, we see serial killers and villains / antagonists being portrayed as “psychopaths” and / or “sociopaths”. It’s time we educate those around us that personality disorders are tragic illnesses brought on often by our environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Antagonising and vilifying mental heath issues is a huge problem and only causes narrow minded beliefs that anyone who is diagnosed with a PD is simply insane and should be treated like monsters.
Blaming those who suffer from any mental health condition is morally wrong, and blaming those with any PD for their mental health should be seen as wrong just as much.

rejection.details:
We understand you are concerned about how personality disorders are portrayed in the media and in films, however it's not clear who you want to be educated about such disorders, nor how. 

If you wish to complain about how a personality disorder has been portrayed in a particular TV programme, you could complain to the independent regulator Ofcom. You can find out how to do this here: https://www.ofcom.org.uk/complaints.

You may like to sign this petition which calls for related action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577667

attributes.action: Allow military police personnel who have no UCAS points to join the civil police
attributes.background: Change the entry criteria for joining the civil police to allow people with military police experience who do not have 63 UCAS points to join the police constabularies within the UK
attributes.additional_details: To enable military personnel who have military police experience the opportunity to leave the military environment and pursue a career within the civil police force. At present, school leavers at the age of 18 with no life experience who have a 63 UCAS points in any subject, can apply for the civil police force due to the law changing in 2020. However, people with no UCAS points but have numerous years experience within the military police cannot join. I consider this extremely unfair.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about entry requirements for the police are a matter for the independent College of Policing, not the UK Government or Parliament. You can find out more about how this works here: https://recruit.college.police.uk/Officer/Pages/eligibility.aspx

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could start a petition calling for the Government to commission a review into barriers to entry to the police for former military personnel, if that is something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: I would like the Government to end period poverty
attributes.background: I would like the Government to offer each girl from school age onwards a pack of free washable sanitary pads. Period poverty is still a real problem and the disposable sanitary pads are bad for the environment. This would reduce waste , be better for the environment and would be less expensive.
attributes.additional_details: Girls and women may feel embarrassed that they can't afford sanitary products. They may resort to using other items each month such as cut up rags. If each girl had a free pack of washable pads then it would reduce waste caused by sanitary products. It would stop embarrassment for girls and women as they would always have them and could reuse then. It would be much cheaper in the long run and research shows washable pads are better for women than disposable ones.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584711

attributes.action: Remove single use plastic bags from supermarkets
attributes.background: The current cost of single use plastic bags in supermarkets is too low to deter the majority of customers from purchasing them. Remove the the option of purchasing single use plastic bags for 10p. Instead only sell multi-use bag options such as 'bags for life' for a minimum of £1.
attributes.additional_details: The current volumes of plastic waste in our oceans and environment is shocking and is only increasing. Single use plastic bags from supermarkets directly contribute to plastic pollution which could be easily avoided. We need to act now before it's too late. By only having the higher price £1 multi-use bag options, customers will be more likely to remember to bring a bag instead of purchasing new ones each time.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581139

attributes.action: Plant trees with every new home built
attributes.background: I want the government to make it a condition of planning permission for developers creating new homes to be under obligation to plant a minimum of two trees per property created.
attributes.additional_details: Recently there have been several large developments approved in my local area of Sefton. Some of the developments have now completed areas of the properties. On a walk last week, I passed by such a development and I noticed that not one garden had a single tree in it. We are loosing green space at an alarming rate due to property development and whilst we are destroying the habitats of millions of creatures by doing this, the least we can do is pledge to give something back to the environment.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/572398

attributes.action: Extend the period allowing councils to meet remotely
attributes.background: Local councils have worked tirelessly to continue working remotely during the pandemic and many have now realised that it is in fact, in many ways, more efficient. The public have found it easier and more convenient to join in meetings.
attributes.additional_details: Insisting on returning to face to face meetings  is bad for democracy, bad for the environment and potentially bad for public health. It would also prove almost impossible for small parish councils to arrange a covid safe environment.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Extend local authorities' power to hold virtual meetings beyond 7 May
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581311

attributes.action: INTRODUCE A COVID PASSPORT BY AUTUMN 2021
attributes.background: INTRODUCE A COMBINED UK HOME AND INTERNATIONAL TRAVEL COVID AND PANDEMIC VACCINATION PASSPORT BY THE AUTUMN OF 2021
attributes.additional_details: THE PUBLIC SHOULD BE OFFERED THE OPPORTUNITY TO JUDGE THE RISK OF VIRAL INFECTION ARISING FROM ANY MEANS OF TRANSPORT BUT ALSO IN LOCATIONS AND ACTIVITIES THAT THEY  ENCOUNTER EVERY DAY. ALL BUSINESSES OR ORGANISATIONS THAT INVOLVE LARGE GROUPS OF PEOPLE IN CLOSE PROXIMITY, WHETHER EMPLOYEES OR CUSTOMERS SHOULD PROMINENTLY DISPLAY AT ALL ENTRANCES IF THEIR ENVIRONMENT IS AN OPEN ONE OR ACCESSIBLE ONLY TO THOSE SHOWING PASSPORTS AND TO REGULATE ACCESS ACCORDING TO THEIR STATEMENT

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575297

If you would like the Government to create new restrictions relating to vaccine passports, we could accept a petition about this, but it would need to be clear what restrictions you wanted to be imposed.

attributes.action: Include mandatory LGBTQIA+ sex education in Scottish secondary schools
attributes.background: Secondary schools across the UK rarely include LGBTQIA+ people in sex education in schools, this leads to many queer youths going without any education on sexual health. Provide the resources for teachers to educate pupils about Queer sexual health and relationships and make it mandatory to do so.
attributes.additional_details: As a Queer person in school I was taught nothing about queer relationships or sexual health. There are little to no LGBTQ+ resources in school and teachers are expected to support queer students with no knowledge or experience. This leaves Queer youth to educate themselves and can lead to them feeling isolated in an environment that only supports heterosexual sex education. Many teachers do not have the resources or choose not to provide this education and that choice should not be up to them.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here:

http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx

attributes.action: Stop allowing the bee-killing pesticide to be reintroduced
attributes.background: The British government will be allowing EU banned pesticides Neonicotinoid Thiamethoxam to be used on crops during 2021. We must not reintroduce this pesticide, or we will see the heightened decline of a vital species as well as a major loss in profit for the economy.
attributes.additional_details: Since the ban on Neonicotinoids in the EU, there has not been any dramatic decrease in crop yield as predicted. This pesticide is lethal to bees and other pollinators which our environment desperately needs to pollinate flora and fauna. Pollinators, according to the Bee Coalition, are responsible for a net £690 million worth of crops annually in the UK, more than what the Royal Family provide. They are essential for the efficient pollination of crops, such as oilseed rape, tomatoes and apples.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563943
